alert.note: Alert for Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin; Laramie East High Plains; Niobrara, Lower Elevations of Converse, Thunder Basin National Grassland (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 07 at 1:48PM MDT until September 08 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF SOUTHEAST WYOMING AND A FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR THE NEBRASKA PANHANDLE THURSDAY DUE TO GUSTY WEST WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WEST WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 417... 431...433 AND 434 THROUGH 437... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 7 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 417...431...433 and 434 through 437. * WIND...West to northwest winds 10 to 20 mph sustained with gusts to 30 mph possible. Winds shift to northeast at 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph early afternoon from north to south. * HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent. * HAINES...5 TO 6 * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated dry thunderstorms are likely Thursday afternoon leading to additional fire starts. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin; Laramie East High Plains; Niobrara, Lower Elevations of Converse, Thunder Basin National Grassland
